TopicTitle: How many fingers would Kerbals have?

Articles.Content: Self explanatory question, they have gloves all the time!
Three fingers and a thumb, like The Simpsons.

http://inspirationration.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/Kerbal-Scientist.gif

and that gentlemen, i believe is checkmate lol

It depends on what was the last thing they were doing.....

Kerbals are not known for their safety.

It depends on what was the last thing they were doing.....

Kerbals are not known for their safety.

So, somewhere between zero and three, on each hand. Got it.

There is a scientific theory that explains however that kerbals have similiar regenerative properties as lizards. This is based on the observation that they are green. Just as we have found out by examining their green spectrum that they are immune to radiation.

There is a scientific theory that explains however that kerbals have similiar regenerative properties as lizards. This is based on the observation that they are green. Just as we have found out by examining their green spectrum that they are immune to radiation.

And of course, they clearly are capable of photosynthesis. This must help fuel their regenerative capability.
Lots of good Kerbal SCIENCE! going on in this thread.
They're not "fingers", they're tentacles! As I've explained before, Kerbals are similar to Earth's cephalopods and have no bones, rather two pairs of tentacles with mini-tentacles on the ends.

And of course, they clearly are capable of photosynthesis. This must help fuel their regenerative capability.

Actually, that explains how they can survive in space for so long with only a few snacks!
Cartoon, in this case kartoon, characters almost always have three fingers and a thumb.
